questions.question: Slow circulating rates through riser then choke line. Main reason?
questions.explanation: SCR through both paths lets you calculate CLFL by comparing the pressures.

questions.question: Top hole with riser: 10 ppg mud, 8.6 ppg seawater, 1800 ft hole, 900 ft water. Minimum mud for disconnect?
questions.explanation: Must maintain balance even if seawater replaces mud in riser. Calculate riser margin and add to formation balance requirement.

questions.question: Floating rig conditions affecting mud volume readings (SELECT THREE):
questions.explanation: Crane ops change deck weight affecting draft. Heave moves riser volume. Pitch/roll affects riser geometry.

questions.question: Methods to determine CLF on subsea BOP (SELECT THREE):

options.B: Pump mud down drillstring up riser then chokeline, measure difference
options.D: Pump mud down kill line up riser
options.E: Pump kill line up chokeline, divide by 2

questions.explanation: CLFL measured by comparing flow paths. Down DS up riser vs up choke gives difference.

questions.question: Gas enters choke line during subsea kill. Choke operator action?
questions.explanation: Gas in choke line = lighter column = pressure drop. Must CLOSE choke to maintain backpressure.

questions.question: Subsea, first circulation, pump rate decreased holding casing constant. BHP?
questions.explanation: Reduced pump rate = reduced CLFL. If casing constant at surface, actual BHP drops by the CLFL reduction.
